Class TwoInputGate

  • java.lang.Object
    • Gate
      • LogicGate
        • TwoInputGate
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AndGate, OrGate

    abstract class TwoInputGate
extends LogicGate
    Handles the properties common to logic gates with two inputs Specifically, all two-input gates have two input wires, in1 an in2.
    See Also:
    Gate, LogicGate

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkSanity()
      check the sanity of this gate's connections, by ensuring that all of its input pins are in use by a wire
      java.lang.String inPinName(int pinNumber)
      get the name of the input pin, given its number, if the number is valid
      void inputChangeEvent(float time, int dstPin, boolean v)
      simulate the change of one of this gate's inputs, this will call update value for one of its subclasses which will handle simulating the result of an input change to one of its pins
      int registerInput(Wire w, java.lang.String pinName)
      tell the gate that one of its input pins is in use
      (package private) abstract void updateValue(float time)
      update the output value of a gate based on its input values This is called from inputChangeEvent to delegate the response of the logic gate to the input change to the actual gate instead of this abstract class.

      • updateValue

        abstract void updateValue(float time)
        update the output value of a gate based on its input values This is called from inputChangeEvent to delegate the response of the logic gate to the input change to the actual gate instead of this abstract class.
        Parameters:
        time - the value is updated

      • inputChangeEvent

        public void inputChangeEvent(float time,
                             int dstPin,
                             boolean v)
        simulate the change of one of this gate's inputs, this will call update value for one of its subclasses which will handle simulating the result of an input change to one of its pins
        Specified by:
        inputChangeEvent in class Gate
        Parameters:
        time - the time when the input changes
        dstPin - the pin that changes
        v - the new logic value
        See Also:
        AndGate, OrGate, updateValue
